section: 11. The Managers will jointly decide major issues concerning the Venture. Where Managers are unable to reach agreement in deciding major issues, approval by a majority vote of the Managers will be required.
explanation: The managers of the joint venture are appointed to manage and dictate policy. The initial sentence states the managers will jointly decide all issues, whereas the second sentence states that a majority vote of the managers will be required if an agreement cannot be met. This means that technically one manager could overrule the other manager causing a disagreement when it comes to deciding major issues.

section: Member Contribution Description BorrowMoney.com, inc 1, 500 square feet of Leased/rent office Space Includingspecified Description of duty* $3,500,000.00 USD JVLS, LLC dba Vaccines 2Go $60,000.00 USD From Monthly Government , City And State, And Or Private Awarded Contracts. Plus (10%) Of Any Generated Gross Revenue, In Add i t i on to The To ta l Contributions. $3,500,000.00 USD
explanation: The assigned value for each member is an inconsistency. BorrowMoney.com, inc is contributing 1,500 square feet of leased/rent office space that is valued at $3,500,000.00 USD, whereas JVLS, LLC is contributing $60,000.00 USD a month that is valued at $3,500,000.00 USD. There is no consistency with the assigned value of each member.

section: 50. No Member will be liable to the Venture or to any other Member for any error in judgment or any act or failure to act where made in good faith. The Member will be liable for any and all acts or failures to act resulting from gross negligence or willful misconduct.
explanation: This section creates a contradiction. In the first sentence, the members are not liable for the venture when made in good faith. The second sentence means that the members will be liable for any and all acts or failures to act resulting from gross negligence or willful misconduct. This means there is no good faith.
